meanings.definition: A necktie or scarf worn around the neck.
meanings.sent1: He wore a stylish cravat to the party.
meanings.sent2: The gentleman adjusted his cravat before entering the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the cravat, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a colorful cravat brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The silk cravat felt smooth against his skin.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a cravat.
meanings.sent1: She decided to cravat her hair with a ribbon.
meanings.sent2: He carefully cravatted the package with a bow.
meanings.sent3: The magician cravatted the scarves together in a surprising trick.
meanings.sent4: His words cravatted our attention, holding us spellbound.
meanings.sent5: The vines cravatted around the tree, creating a natural knot.
